alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Indian River; Martin; Northern Brevard County; Southern Brevard County; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued February 27 at 3:17AM EST until February 28 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Numerous strong, potentially life-threatening rip currents in the surf zone. * WHERE...Martin, Coastal Volusia, Northern Brevard, Southern Brevard, St. Lucie and Indian River Counties. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Entering the surf, especially the cooler than normal waters offshore Volusia County, is strongly discouraged today due to the dangerous rip current conditions.
info.instruction: Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away from shore, which occur most often at low spots or breaks in the sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as jetties and piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards, beach patrol flags and signs.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Volusia; Indian River; Martin; Northern Brevard County; Southern Brevard County; St. Lucie
